rev.diff:
Line 75: Line 75:
== AAC Support==
== AAC Support==
â
Creative claims that the Zen supports [[Advanced Audio Coding|AAC]] however it does not mention that only [[iTunes]]-encoded AAC files can be played by the player hardware. iTunes's implementation of AAC has been licensed by [[Apple Inc.|Apple]] from [[Dolby Laboratories|Dolby]] and is proprietary. The Zen fails to play AAC files (Low complexity and High Efficiency profiles) encoded by all other applications such as [[Nero (computer software)|Nero]], [[Winamp]] etc. Creative has acknowledged this issue in a support article, <ref> [http://support.creative.com/kb/ShowArticle.aspx?sid=45327 "Audio Format is not supported" while Playing Back AAC files in ZEN and ZEN X-Fi] </ref> however it does not state this in the Zen's technical specifications.
+
Creative claims that the Zen supports [[Advanced Audio Coding|AAC]] however it does not mention that only [[iTunes]]-encoded AAC files can be played by the player hardware. iTunes's implementation of AAC has been licensed by [[Apple Inc.|Apple]] from [[Dolby Laboratories|Dolby]] and is proprietary. The Zen fails to play AAC files (Low complexity and High Efficiency profiles) encoded by all other applications such as [[Nero (software suite)|Nero]], [[Winamp]] etc. Creative has acknowledged this issue in a support article, <ref> [http://support.creative.com/kb/ShowArticle.aspx?sid=45327 "Audio Format is not supported" while Playing Back AAC files in ZEN and ZEN X-Fi] </ref> however it does not state this in the Zen's technical specifications.
